meanings.definition: Gloomy or sullen in mood or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The rainy weather made the forest look glumpy.
meanings.sent2: She felt glumpy after receiving bad news.
meanings.sent3: Even the sun seemed glumpy behind the dark clouds.
meanings.sent4: His glumpy expression matched the stormy sky.
meanings.sent5: The glumpy atmosphere in the room was palpable.

meanings.definition: Covered in a thick, sticky substance.
meanings.sent1: The spilled syrup left the table glumpy.
meanings.sent2: Her hands were glumpy after working with clay.
meanings.sent3: The glumpy mud clung to his shoes as he walked.
meanings.sent4: The glumpy paint dripped slowly down the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The glumpy texture of the glue made it hard to remove.

meanings.sent1: She accidentally stepped in a puddle of glumpy.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a dollop of glumpy to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they played with the glumpy.
meanings.sent4: The glumpy on the tree bark attracted curious insects.
meanings.sent5: The jar contained a mysterious glumpy that no one could identify.
